name: Confucius
central_question: How should social and moral order be cultivated?
methodology: Aphoristic teaching, dialogic instruction, compilation by disciples
core_concepts: Ren (benevolence), Li (ritual), Junzi (moral exemplar)
key_works: Analects (compiled)
neutral_academic_note: Central founder of Confucian ethical-political thought; core text-based tradition shaping East Asian institutions.

name: Buddha (Siddhartha Gautama)
central_question: How can suffering be ended?
methodology: Reflective practice, discourse, monastic code and suttas
core_concepts: Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, Anatta, Impermanence
key_works: Dhammapada; Sutta collections (oral tradition)
neutral_academic_note: Founder of Buddhism; doctrinal and practical tradition with global historical influence.

name: Laozi (Lao Tzu)
central_question: How to live in harmony with the Dao (Way)?
methodology: Paradoxical aphorism; poetic aphorisms (Dao De Jing)
core_concepts: Dao, Wu wei (non-action), Naturalness
key_works: Tao Te Ching (attrib.)
neutral_academic_note: Attributed author of Daoist foundational text; formative for East Asian thought and spirituality.

name: Socrates
central_question: What is the good life and how should one live?
methodology: Maieutic questioning (Socratic dialogue), ethical questioning
core_concepts: Self-knowledge, examined life, virtue as knowledge
key_works: (No writings; reported in Platonic/ Xenophontic dialogues)
neutral_academic_note: Foundational figure in Western philosophy; influence known through students’ records.

name: Mozi (Mo Tzu)
central_question: How should social order be achieved and what is moral conduct?
methodology: Logico-practical argumentation; utilitarian-like social ethics
core_concepts: Universal love (jian ai), anti-fatalism, meritocratic governance
key_works: Mozi (collected essays)
neutral_academic_note: Critic of Confucian ritualism; emphasized impartial caring and practical governance.

name: Mencius (Mengzi)
central_question: Is human nature fundamentally good, and how should it be cultivated?
methodology: Dialogues, moral psychology, textual exegesis of Confucian tradition
core_concepts: Innate goodness, moral sprouts, righteous rule
key_works: Mencius (collected dialogues)
neutral_academic_note: Systematized a doctrine of innate moral tendencies within Confucian framework; central classical Confucian text.

name: Chuang Tzu (Zhuangzi)
central_question: How to live naturally and freely in accord with the Dao?
methodology: Parables, skeptical relativism, literary fable
core_concepts: Relativity of value, spontaneity, freedom from conventions
key_works: Zhuangzi (collection of stories and parables)
neutral_academic_note: Major literary-philosophical articulator of Daoist themes; influential in East Asian thought and literary traditions.

name: Plato
central_question: What is justice and what is the ideal polity?
methodology: Dialogical dialectic, metaphysical theory (Forms), utopian political analysis
core_concepts: Theory of Forms, philosopher-king, tripartite soul
key_works: Republic; Symposium; Phaedo; Laws
expression_style: Dialogic philosophical drama; myth and allegory
neutral_academic_note: Major architect of Western metaphysics and political philosophy; teacher of Aristotle.

name: Diogenes of Sinope
central_question: How to live according to nature and reject artificial social conventions?
methodology: Exemplary provocation, public performance, ascetic practice
core_concepts: Parresia (frankness), self-sufficiency, cosmopolitanism
key_works: (No extant writings; reported anecdotes)
neutral_academic_note: Famous Cynic figure whose life-as-teaching influenced later ascetic and moral-critical traditions.

name: Aristotle
central_question: What are the principles of being, knowledge, and ethical flourishing?
methodology: Systematic empirical observation, classification, syllogistic logic
core_concepts: Substance, four causes, virtue ethics (golden mean)
key_works: Nicomachean Ethics; Politics; Metaphysics; Poetics; Posterior Analytics
neutral_academic_note: Authoritative across many disciplines; foundational to medieval scholasticism and early science.

name: Epicurus
central_question: How can individuals attain tranquility and freedom from fear?
methodology: Empirically grounded ethical hedonism; atomistic metaphysics
core_concepts: Ataraxia (tranquility), pleasure as absence of pain, atomism
key_works: Letter to Menoeceus; Principal Doctrines (fragments)
neutral_academic_note: Founded Epicurean school proposing naturalistic ethics and calming remedies for fear of gods/death.

name: Nagarjuna
central_question: What is the ontological status of phenomena (emptiness)?
methodology: Prasangika reductio; dialectical refutation of inherent existence
core_concepts: Sunyata (emptiness), two truths (conventional/ultimate)
key_works: Mulamadhyamakakarika (Fundamental Verses on the Middle Way)
neutral_academic_note: Principal systematizer of Madhyamaka; central in Mahayana Buddhist metaphysics.

name: Plotinus
central_question: How does multiplicity proceed from the One and how can the soul return?
methodology: Contemplative metaphysical ascent; systematic treatise (Enneads as compiled by Porphyry)
core_concepts: The One, emanation, intellect (nous), soul
key_works: The Enneads (compiled)
neutral_academic_note: Founder of Neoplatonism; significant influence on later Christian and Islamic mystical thought.

name: Augustine of Hippo
central_question: How are grace, sin, and human will related in salvation?
methodology: Theological synthesis of Scripture and Platonism; confessional narrative
core_concepts: Original sin, grace, City of God vs. earthly city
key_works: Confessions; City of God
neutral_academic_note: Pivotal figure in Western Christian theology shaping medieval thought on sin and grace.

name: Hypatia
central_question: How can mathematical reasoning illuminate cosmology and philosophy?
methodology: Commentary, lecturing, mathematical exposition
core_concepts: Mathematical rigor; Platonic philosophy applied to science
key_works: (Commentaries on Ptolemy & Diophantus — mostly lost)
neutral_academic_note: Leading female intellectual of Alexandria; symbol of classical learning and martyrdom for scholarship.

name: Al-Farabi
central_question: What is the ideal political order and role of virtuous intellect?
methodology: Synthesis of Plato and Aristotle; systematic philosophical treatise
core_concepts: Virtuous city, emanation, active intellect
key_works: The Virtuous City; On the Perfect State
neutral_academic_note: Major transmitter and synthesizer of Greek philosophy into Islamic intellectual tradition; influenced medieval scholasticism.

name: Adi Shankara
central_question: What is the nature of ultimate reality (Brahman) and the self (Atman)?
methodology: Scriptural exegesis; commentary tradition; dialectical refutation of dualist positions
core_concepts: Advaita (non-duality), Maya (illusion), identity of Atman and Brahman
key_works: Brahmasutra Bhashya; Upadeshasahasri (commentaries)
expression_style: Concise Sanskrit commentary and polemical argument
neutral_academic_note: Major consolidator of Advaita Vedanta; central in later Hindu philosophical theology.

name: Avicenna (Ibn Sina)
central_question: What are the conditions for knowledge and the metaphysical structure of being?
methodology: Systematic philosophical and medical synthesis; logical-metaphysical demonstration
core_concepts: Essence–existence distinction, Active intellect, soul theory
key_works: The Canon of Medicine; The Book of Healing (al-Shifa)
neutral_academic_note: Key systematizer of Aristotelian thought in Islamic world; major influence on Latin scholasticism and medicine.

name: Al-Ghazali
central_question: How can one attain certainty and reconcile reason with faith?
methodology: Skeptical critique of rationalist philosophers; theological synthesis; mystical practice
core_concepts: Occasionalism, critique of falsafa, spiritual purification
key_works: The Incoherence of the Philosophers; Revival of Religious Sciences (Ihya)
expression_style: Persuasive theological prose and mystical exposition
neutral_academic_note: Influential critic of Islamic peripatetic philosophy and pivotal in reasserting theocentric theological approaches.

name: Sundiata Keita
central_question: How should a just and stable polity be founded and governed?
methodology: Oral charter, exemplifying rulership, customary codification
core_concepts: Social justice, cohesion (asabiyyah), kingship duties
key_works: Mandé Charter (oral tradition)
neutral_academic_note: Founder of Mali Empire; associated with early West African chartering of rights and governance practices (oral tradition).

name: Ibn Arabi
central_question: What is the relationship between God and creation?
methodology: Mystical-intuitional exposition; poetic metaphysical commentary
core_concepts: Unity of Being, Perfect Man (insan kamil), spiritual hierarchy
key_works: Fusus al-Hikam; The Meccan Revelations
neutral_academic_note: Highly influential Sufi metaphysician whose works permeate later Islamic and comparative mysticism.

name: Rumi (Jalal ad-Din Rumi)
central_question: How can the self unite with the Divine?
methodology: Poetic mysticism, didactic storytelling, poetry as spiritual teaching
core_concepts: Divine love, annihilation (fana), union (baqa)
key_works: Mathnawi; Divan-e Shams
neutral_academic_note: One of the most read mystical poets globally; influenced devotional literature and Sufi practice.

name: Thomas Aquinas
central_question: How can faith and reason be reconciled?
methodology: Scholastic disputation, systematic synthesis of Aristotelian philosophy and Christian theology
core_concepts: Natural law, essence–existence, Five Ways (proofs of God)
key_works: Summa Theologica; Summa contra Gentiles
neutral_academic_note: Principal medieval synthesizer of Aristotle and Christian doctrine; profound influence on Catholic theology and philosophy.

name: John Duns Scotus
central_question: How is individuation possible and what is the primacy of will/intellect?
methodology: Subtle scholastic distinctions; metaphysical analyses of individuation (haecceity)
core_concepts: Haecceity, univocity of being, will over intellect emphasis
key_works: Ordinatio; Quaestiones
neutral_academic_note: Important medieval thinker developing alternatives to Thomism; influential in late scholastic debates.

name: William of Ockham
central_question: What should count as explanatory entities in metaphysics and theology?
methodology: Logical economy, parsimonious explanation (Ockham’s razor)
core_concepts: Nominalism, divine omnipotence, methodological parsimony
key_works: Summa Logicae; Quodlibetal Questions
neutral_academic_note: Founder of nominalist movement; his methodological parsimony influenced modern science and philosophy.

name: Ibn Khaldun
central_question: Why do civilizations rise and fall?
methodology: Comparative historical method; sociological analysis (Asabiyyah concept)
core_concepts: Asabiyyah (social cohesion), cyclical theory of civilization, urbanization effects
key_works: Muqaddimah (Prolegomena)
neutral_academic_note: Early founder of historiography and systematic social analysis; prefigured later social-scientific inquiry.

name: Guru Nanak
central_question: How can spiritual realization be attained through devotion and service?
methodology: Devotional poetry, hymns, community formation
core_concepts: Ik Onkar (one God), seva (selfless service), equality
key_works: Guru Granth Sahib (compiled later with his hymns)
neutral_academic_note: Founder of Sikh religious tradition emphasizing equality and devotional practice.

name: Niccolò Machiavelli
school_of_thought: Political realism / early modern political analysis
central_question: How is political power actually acquired and maintained?
methodology: Historical-empirical political analysis; realist prescription
core_concepts: Virtù, Fortuna, statecraft, separation of morals from political necessity
key_works: The Prince; Discourses on Livy
neutral_academic_note: Key early modern theorist separating normative ethics from pragmatic statecraft; foundational to modern political science.

name: Nezahualcoyotl
central_question: How do beauty, ethics, and rulership interrelate?
methodology: Poetic composition, courtly rulership, ritual practice
core_concepts: Flower-and-song (in xochitl-in cuicatl), ephemeral beauty, divine kingship
key_works: Nahuatl poems (collected in later sources)
neutral_academic_note: Ruler-poet of Texcoco; important source for pre-Columbian intellectual and poetic traditions.

name: William Shakespeare
central_question: What does it mean to be human?
methodology: Dramatic representation, psychological characterization, poetic language
core_concepts: Tragic hero, human complexity, language as action
key_works: Hamlet; King Lear; Othello; Macbeth; many plays and poems
neutral_academic_note: Principal dramatist of English Renaissance; formative for modern literature and character psychology.

name: Mulla Sadra (Sadr al-Din al-Shirazi)
era: Islamic Golden Age / Early Modern (Islamic philosophy)
central_question: How does existence manifest and what is primacy of existence?
methodology: Mystical-intellectual synthesis merging Peripateticism, illuminationism, Sufism
core_concepts: Substantial motion, primacy of existence, unity of knower and known
key_works: The Four Journeys (al-Asfar al-Arba'a)
neutral_academic_note: Influential Persian philosopher synthesizing diverse Islamic philosophical trends into an existential metaphysics.

name: Thomas Hobbes
school_of_thought: Social contract theory / early modern absolutism
central_question: How can social order be secured against the state of nature?
methodology: Rationalist deduction from hypothetical state-of-nature premises; political prescription
core_concepts: Leviathan (sovereign), social contract, natural equality and competition
key_works: Leviathan
expression_style: Dense systematic prose with geometric-deductive style at times
neutral_academic_note: Founder of modern political theory emphasizing strong sovereign power as remedy to social conflict.

name: René Descartes
central_question: How can secure certain knowledge be achieved?
methodology: Methodical doubt, analytic geometry, foundationalist epistemology (cogito)
core_concepts: Cogito ergo sum, mind–body dualism, clear and distinct ideas
key_works: Meditations on First Philosophy; Discourse on Method
expression_style: Methodical meditative prose and mathematical exposition
neutral_academic_note: Founding figure of modern epistemology and rationalist metaphysics; shaped scientific method and modern philosophy.

name: Baruch Spinoza
central_question: How can human freedom be understood within necessary causal order?
methodology: Geometric-deductive exposition; monist metaphysics
core_concepts: Substance monism (God or Nature), conatus, ethical rationalism
key_works: Ethics; Tractatus Theologico-Politicus
neutral_academic_note: Radical rationalist whose monistic metaphysics challenged religious orthodoxy and influenced Enlightenment thought.

name: John Locke
central_question: What legitimizes political authority and what are the limits of human knowledge?
methodology: Empirical analysis of ideas; social contract argumentation
core_concepts: Tabula rasa, natural rights, consent of the governed
key_works: Two Treatises of Government; Essay Concerning Human Understanding
expression_style: Clear argumentative prose aimed at reform and policy
neutral_academic_note: Principal exponent of liberal political theory and empiricist epistemology; crucial to modern constitutionalism.

name: Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz
central_question: Why is there something rather than nothing and what is metaphysical harmony?
methodology: Logical analysis, metaphysical system-building, mathematical invention (calculus)
core_concepts: Monad, pre-established harmony, sufficient reason
key_works: Monadology; Theodicy; correspondence and essays
neutral_academic_note: Major rationalist metaphysician and inventor in mathematics; argued for harmonious cosmology and optimism.

name: Montesquieu
central_question: How can political structures prevent tyranny?
methodology: Comparative-historical analysis of laws and climates; constitutional theory
core_concepts: Separation of powers, checks and balances, political moderation
key_works: The Spirit of the Laws; Persian Letters
expression_style: Comparative analytic prose with historical examples
neutral_academic_note: Influential in framing constitutional separation of powers and modern institutional analysis.

name: Mary Wollstonecraft
central_question: Are women entitled to the same education and rights as men?
methodology: Rational critique and political argumentation for rights and education
core_concepts: Rights of woman, rational education, equality
key_works: A Vindication of the Rights of Woman
neutral_academic_note: Foundational voice in feminist political theory advocating women's rational capacity and education.

name: Voltaire (François-Marie Arouet)
central_question: How to expose intolerance, superstition, and dogma?
methodology: Satire, polemic, dramatic critique, advocacy for tolerance
core_concepts: Religious tolerance, critique of superstition, freedom of expression
key_works: Candide; Philosophical Letters; numerous essays and plays
neutral_academic_note: Leading public intellectual of the French Enlightenment advocating civil liberties and critique of clerical power.

name: David Hume
central_question: What are the limits of human knowledge and the nature of causation?
methodology: Empirical analysis of ideas; skeptical argumentation about induction and causation
core_concepts: Causation as habit, skepticism about metaphysics, empirical moral psychology
key_works: A Treatise of Human Nature; Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding
expression_style: Clear ironic prose with philosophical exposition
neutral_academic_note: Central figure in modern empiricism; his critique of causation and induction shaped later epistemology.

name: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
school_of_thought: Romantic critique of modernity; social contract theory variant
central_question: How does modern society affect human freedom and authenticity?
methodology: Social critique, autobiographical reflection, political theory
core_concepts: General will, natural man, critique of inequality
key_works: The Social Contract; Emile; Confessions
neutral_academic_note: Influential in political romanticism and revolutionary-era thought; complex legacy for democratic and authoritarian readings.

name: Adam Smith
central_question: How do market mechanisms and moral sentiments shape social cooperation?
methodology: Empirical observation, philosophical political economy
core_concepts: Invisible hand, division of labor, moral sentiments
key_works: The Wealth of Nations; The Theory of Moral Sentiments
expression_style: Clear systematic prose combining moral and economic argument
neutral_academic_note: Founder of classical economics and influential theorist of market society and moral psychology.

name: Immanuel Kant
central_question: What are the conditions of possible experience and knowledge?
methodology: Transcendental critique; systematic philosophical argumentation
core_concepts: Synthetic a priori, categorical imperative, autonomy of practical reason
key_works: Critique of Pure Reason; Critique of Practical Reason; Groundwork of the Metaphysics of Morals
neutral_academic_note: One of modern philosophy’s central architects; revolutionized epistemology and ethics with transcendental method.

name: Jeremy Bentham
central_question: How can social policy maximize collective welfare?
methodology: Consequentialist calculus; legal and institutional reform advocacy
core_concepts: Greatest happiness principle, felicific calculus, legal reform
key_works: An Introduction to the Principles of Morals and Legislation
expression_style: Systematic utilitarian prose and legal argumentation
neutral_academic_note: Founder of modern utilitarianism and advocate of systematic legal and penal reform.

name: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
central_question: How does Spirit realize freedom through historical development?
methodology: Systematic dialectic, speculative philosophy, philosophy of history
core_concepts: Dialectic, Absolute Spirit, master–slave dialectic, philosophy of history
key_works: Phenomenology of Spirit; Philosophy of Right
neutral_academic_note: Architect of dialectical system influencing 19th–20th century continental philosophy and political theory.

name: William Wordsworth
central_question: How can nature inspire moral and aesthetic sensibilities?
methodology: Lyrical poetry, reflection on human–nature interaction
core_concepts: Nature, Imagination, Emotion, Sublime
key_works: Lyrical Ballads; The Prelude
neutral_academic_note: Central figure in English Romantic poetry; emphasized nature and emotional depth.

name: Charles Darwin
central_question: How do species evolve through natural selection?
methodology: Empirical observation, comparative anatomy, theory building
core_concepts: Natural Selection, Evolution, Adaptation
key_works: On the Origin of Species; The Descent of Man
neutral_academic_note: Founder of evolutionary biology; reshaped life sciences and social thought.

name: John Stuart Mill
central_question: How can individual liberty coexist with social order?
methodology: Ethical reasoning, empirical observation, utilitarian calculus
core_concepts: Liberty, Utilitarianism, Representative Government
key_works: On Liberty; Utilitarianism; Principles of Political Economy
neutral_academic_note: Major contributor to liberal political thought and ethics; influential in economics and social reform.

name: Søren Kierkegaard
central_question: How should the individual relate to faith, existence, and choice?
methodology: Existential analysis, pseudonymous authorship, dialectical method
core_concepts: Subjectivity, Faith, Anxiety, Leap of Faith
key_works: Either/Or; Fear and Trembling; The Sickness Unto Death
neutral_academic_note: Father of existential philosophy; influenced theology, literature, and 20th-century existentialists.

name: Karl Marx
central_question: How do economic structures shape society and history?
methodology: Historical materialism, critique of political economy, dialectical analysis
core_concepts: Class Struggle, Capital, Historical Materialism, Alienation
key_works: Das Kapital; The Communist Manifesto
neutral_academic_note: Pioneering theorist in socialism and political economy; shaped modern social science and revolutionary movements.

name: Friedrich Engels
central_question: How can society be analyzed and transformed through class relations?
methodology: Collaboration with Marx, historical materialism, critique of capitalism
core_concepts: Class Struggle, Socialist Theory, Industrial Society
key_works: The Condition of the Working Class in England; Co-author of The Communist Manifesto
neutral_academic_note: Co-founder of Marxist theory; bridged philosophy and political activism.

name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
central_question: How do moral, psychological, and spiritual dilemmas shape human existence?
methodology: Psychological realism, narrative exploration, philosophical dialogue
core_concepts: Freedom, Guilt, Redemption, Human Nature
key_works: Crime and Punishment; The Brothers Karamazov; Notes from Underground
neutral_academic_note: Explored existential and ethical dimensions of human psychology; foundational to existential literature.

name: William James
central_question: How do beliefs and experience shape human consciousness and action?
methodology: Empirical psychology, philosophical analysis, pragmatist reasoning
core_concepts: Pragmatism, Stream of Consciousness, Radical Empiricism
key_works: The Principles of Psychology; Pragmatism; The Varieties of Religious Experience
neutral_academic_note: Founder of American pragmatism; influenced psychology, philosophy, and religious studies.

name: Friedrich Nietzsche
central_question: How should humans confront the death of God and create meaning?
methodology: Aphoristic writing, genealogical analysis, critique of morality
core_concepts: Will to Power, Eternal Recurrence, Übermensch, Nihilism
key_works: Thus Spoke Zarathustra; Beyond Good and Evil; Genealogy of Morals
neutral_academic_note: Challenged traditional morality and religion; seminal influence on existentialism and modern philosophy.

name: Sigmund Freud
central_question: How does the unconscious mind influence human behavior?
methodology: Clinical observation, case studies, psychoanalytic theory
core_concepts: Unconscious, Id/Ego/Superego, Defense Mechanisms, Psychosexual Stages
key_works: The Interpretation of Dreams; Civilization and Its Discontents
neutral_academic_note: Founder of psychoanalysis; profoundly influenced psychology, literature, and cultural studies.

name: Émile Durkheim
central_question: How do social structures and norms shape human behavior?
methodology: Empirical sociological research, comparative analysis
core_concepts: Social Facts, Collective Conscience, Division of Labor, Suicide Studies
key_works: The Rules of Sociological Method; Suicide; The Elementary Forms of Religious Life
neutral_academic_note: Founder of modern sociology; established sociology as an academic discipline.

name: Edmund Husserl
central_question: How can consciousness and experience be analyzed rigorously?
methodology: Phenomenological reduction, intentionality, rigorous descriptive analysis
core_concepts: Intentionality, Epoché, Phenomenological Method
key_works: Logical Investigations; Ideas: General Introduction to Pure Phenomenology
neutral_academic_note: Founder of phenomenology; influenced 20th-century continental philosophy.

name: Max Weber
central_question: How do culture, economy, and institutions shape society?
methodology: Comparative historical analysis, interpretive sociology
core_concepts: Rationalization, Bureaucracy, Protestant Ethic, Authority Types
key_works: The Protestant Ethic and the Spirit of Capitalism; Economy and Society
neutral_academic_note: Developed foundational concepts in sociology; bridged economics, politics, and cultural analysis.

name: Rabindranath Tagore
central_question: How can art and literature express human universals and spiritual insight?
methodology: Poetry, lyrical prose, music, cultural criticism
core_concepts: Humanism, Spirituality, Cultural Unity, Nature
key_works: Gitanjali; The Home and the World
neutral_academic_note: Nobel laureate in literature; integrated philosophy, literature, and music in cultural thought.

name: Mohandas Gandhi
central_question: How can nonviolence and civil disobedience achieve social and political change?
methodology: Activist praxis, philosophical reflection, political organizing
core_concepts: Nonviolence, Satyagraha, Self-rule, Ethical resistance
key_works: Hind Swaraj; My Experiments with Truth
neutral_academic_note: Leader of Indian independence movement; developed a philosophy of nonviolent social change.

name: Rudolf Steiner
central_question: How can spiritual science guide human development and education?
methodology: Philosophical anthroposophy, holistic education, spiritual-scientific inquiry
core_concepts: Anthroposophy, Waldorf Education, Spiritual Science
key_works: Knowledge of the Higher Worlds; The Philosophy of Freedom
neutral_academic_note: Founder of anthroposophy; influenced education, agriculture, and social philosophy.

name: John Dewey
central_question: How can education and democracy shape human experience and society?
methodology: Empirical philosophy, educational experimentation, reflective inquiry
core_concepts: Experiential Learning, Democracy, Instrumentalism
key_works: Democracy and Education; Experience and Nature
neutral_academic_note: Founder of progressive education in the U.S.; integrated philosophy and educational practice.

name: Henri Bergson
central_question: How does time and consciousness relate to creativity and life?
methodology: Intuitive philosophical analysis, metaphysical reflection
core_concepts: Duration (La durée), Élan Vital, Intuition
key_works: Creative Evolution; Matter and Memory
neutral_academic_note: Developed process philosophy; influenced 20th-century existentialism, psychology, and literature.

name: W. E. B. Du Bois
central_question: How do race and social structures shape human experience?
methodology: Sociological research, historical analysis, activist engagement
core_concepts: Double Consciousness, Race, Social Justice
key_works: The Souls of Black Folk; Black Reconstruction in America
neutral_academic_note: Pioneer in African-American studies; combined scholarship and activism for social reform.

name: B. R. Ambedkar
central_question: How can legal and social reforms eradicate caste-based inequality?
methodology: Legal scholarship, political activism, social philosophy
core_concepts: Social Justice, Caste Abolition, Democracy
key_works: Annihilation of Caste; The Problem of the Rupee
neutral_academic_note: Architect of the Indian Constitution; championed social justice and Dalit rights.

name: Antonio Gramsci
central_question: How do culture and ideology maintain power structures?
methodology: Historical materialism, cultural critique, prison notebooks
core_concepts: Cultural Hegemony, Intellectuals, Passive Revolution
key_works: Prison Notebooks
neutral_academic_note: Developed theory of cultural hegemony; influential in political theory and sociology.

name: Mikhail Bakhtin
central_question: How do dialogue, language, and culture shape meaning?
methodology: Literary analysis, philosophical reflection, cultural critique
core_concepts: Dialogism, Carnivalesque, Heteroglossia
key_works: Problems of Dostoevsky’s Poetics; Rabelais and His World
neutral_academic_note: Pioneer in literary theory; developed concepts of dialogism and cultural critique.

name: Carl Jung
central_question: How do archetypes and the collective unconscious influence human experience?
methodology: Clinical observation, dream analysis, archetypal theory
core_concepts: Collective Unconscious, Archetypes, Individuation
key_works: Psychological Types; Memories, Dreams, Reflections
neutral_academic_note: Founder of analytical psychology; introduced archetypes and the collective unconscious.

name: Albert Einstein
central_question: How do space, time, and energy interrelate in the physical universe?
methodology: Theoretical physics, mathematical modeling, thought experiments
core_concepts: Special Relativity, General Relativity, E=mc², Photoelectric Effect
key_works: Annus Mirabilis Papers; Relativity: The Special and General Theory
neutral_academic_note: Revolutionized physics; foundational to modern cosmology, quantum theory, and technology.

name: Martin Heidegger
central_question: What does it mean to be?
methodology: Phenomenological analysis, hermeneutics, existential inquiry
core_concepts: Being-in-the-world, Dasein, Authenticity, Temporality
key_works: Being and Time
neutral_academic_note: Major figure in 20th-century continental philosophy; foundational for existentialism and hermeneutics.

name: Ludwig Wittgenstein
central_question: How does language shape thought and reality?
methodology: Logical analysis, linguistic philosophy, conceptual clarification
core_concepts: Language Games, Picture Theory of Meaning, Rule-Following
key_works: Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus; Philosophical Investigations
neutral_academic_note: Revolutionized analytic philosophy; transformed philosophy of language and mind.

name: Karl Jaspers
central_question: How can humans confront existence and transcendence?
methodology: Existential analysis, philosophical reflection, psychological inquiry
core_concepts: Existenz, Limit Situation, Transcendence
key_works: Philosophy; Man in the Modern World
neutral_academic_note: Key figure in existentialist philosophy; integrated philosophy with psychiatry.

name: José Ortega y Gasset
central_question: How does life and circumstance shape human existence?
methodology: Philosophical essays, cultural analysis, reflective writing
core_concepts: Radical Reality, Life Philosophy, Perspectivism
key_works: The Revolt of the Masses; Meditations on Quixote
neutral_academic_note: Influential Spanish philosopher; shaped cultural criticism and existential thought in Europe.

name: T.S. Eliot
central_question: How can literature reflect and shape modern consciousness?
methodology: Literary analysis, poetry, cultural critique
core_concepts: Modernist Poetry, Cultural Fragmentation, Literary Tradition
key_works: The Waste Land; Four Quartets
neutral_academic_note: Leading modernist poet and critic; transformed English-language poetry in the 20th century.

name: Franz Kafka
central_question: How does alienation and bureaucracy affect human existence?
methodology: Fictional narratives, existential allegory
core_concepts: Alienation, Absurdity, Bureaucracy, Metamorphosis
key_works: The Trial; The Metamorphosis; The Castle
neutral_academic_note: Iconic literary figure; explored existential alienation and absurdity in 20th-century literature.

name: James Joyce
central_question: How can narrative form express consciousness and identity?
methodology: Experimental literary techniques, stream-of-consciousness, linguistic play
core_concepts: Stream-of-Consciousness, Epiphany, Interior Monologue
key_works: Ulysses; Finnegans Wake; A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
neutral_academic_note: Pioneered stream-of-consciousness technique; transformed modern narrative literature.

name: Virginia Woolf
central_question: How can narrative form reflect consciousness and gender?
methodology: Stream-of-consciousness, essays, literary experimentation
core_concepts: Consciousness, Feminism, Narrative Innovation
key_works: Mrs. Dalloway; To the Lighthouse; A Room of One’s Own
neutral_academic_note: Key figure in modernist literature and feminist critique; explored gender and consciousness.

name: Hannah Arendt
central_question: How do power, evil, and political systems shape human life?
methodology: Philosophical analysis, historical study, political reflection
core_concepts: Banality of Evil, Totalitarianism, Human Condition
key_works: The Origins of Totalitarianism; Eichmann in Jerusalem; The Human Condition
neutral_academic_note: Major political theorist; analyzed totalitarianism, ethics, and human rights.

name: Emmanuel Levinas
central_question: How is ethics grounded in our relation to the Other?
methodology: Phenomenological analysis, ethical reflection, existential inquiry
core_concepts: Ethics as First Philosophy, Otherness, Responsibility
key_works: Totality and Infinity; Otherwise than Being
neutral_academic_note: Developed ethics as foundational philosophy; influential in continental philosophy and theology.

name: Jean-Paul Sartre
central_question: How can humans achieve freedom in a world without inherent meaning?
methodology: Existential analysis, phenomenology, literary narrative
core_concepts: Existence precedes essence, Freedom, Responsibility, Bad Faith
key_works: Being and Nothingness; Nausea; No Exit
neutral_academic_note: Central figure in existentialist thought; integrated philosophy with literature and politics.

name: Simone de Beauvoir
central_question: How can women achieve freedom and equality within existential constraints?
methodology: Philosophical analysis, feminist critique, literary narrative
core_concepts: Otherness, Feminism, Existential Freedom
key_works: The Second Sex; She Came to Stay
neutral_academic_note: Pioneer in feminist philosophy; explored existentialism in gender and social critique.

name: Simone Weil
central_question: How can human suffering and attention inform ethics and social justice?
methodology: Reflective essays, mystical analysis, social observation
core_concepts: Attention, Affliction, Justice, Spirituality
key_works: Gravity and Grace; The Need for Roots
neutral_academic_note: Integrated philosophy, mysticism, and social critique; notable for ethical reflections on suffering.

name: Claude Lévi-Strauss
central_question: How do human societies structure myths, kinship, and culture?
methodology: Structural analysis, ethnography, comparative studies
core_concepts: Structuralism, Mythology, Binary Oppositions, Kinship
key_works: Structural Anthropology; The Savage Mind
neutral_academic_note: Founder of structural anthropology; reshaped the study of culture and human society.

name: Roland Barthes
central_question: How do texts produce meaning and cultural significance?
methodology: Semiotic analysis, textual critique, literary theory
core_concepts: Mythologies, Semiotics, Death of the Author
key_works: Mythologies; S/Z
neutral_academic_note: Key figure in semiotics and literary theory; bridged structuralism and post-structuralism.

name: Marshall McLuhan
central_question: How do media technologies shape human perception and society?
methodology: Media analysis, cultural critique
core_concepts: Medium is the Message, Global Village, Media Ecology
key_works: Understanding Media; The Gutenberg Galaxy
neutral_academic_note: Pioneer in media theory; influential on communication studies and cultural analysis.

name: John Cage
central_question: How can chance and silence redefine musical composition?
methodology: Aleatory music, prepared piano, experimental performance
core_concepts: Chance Operations, Silence, Indeterminacy
key_works: 4’33”; Music of Changes
neutral_academic_note: Pioneering figure in experimental music; explored philosophy through sound and silence.

name: Aimé Césaire
central_question: How can colonized peoples assert cultural identity and dignity?
methodology: Poetic writing, political essays, cultural critique
core_concepts: Negritude, Colonialism, Cultural Identity
key_works: Notebook of a Return to the Native Land; Discourse on Colonialism
neutral_academic_note: Founder of Negritude movement; major influence on post-colonial thought and literature.

name: Paulo Freire
central_question: How can education empower marginalized communities?
methodology: Critical pedagogy, dialogical method, praxis
core_concepts: Banking Model of Education, Conscientization, Praxis
key_works: Pedagogy of the Oppressed; Education for Critical Consciousness
neutral_academic_note: Major figure in critical pedagogy; advocated for education as liberation.

name: R.D. Laing
central_question: How does society influence mental illness and self-identity?
methodology: Clinical observation, existential analysis, social critique
core_concepts: Family Nexus, Alienation, Psychotic Experience
key_works: The Divided Self; Knots
neutral_academic_note: Criticized mainstream psychiatry; emphasized existential dimensions of mental illness.

name: Michel Foucault
central_question: How do power and knowledge shape societies and individuals?
methodology: Genealogical analysis, historical critique, archival research
core_concepts: Power/Knowledge, Disciplinary Societies, Biopolitics, Episteme
key_works: Discipline and Punish; The History of Sexuality
neutral_academic_note: Pioneering figure in critical theory and social philosophy; transformed understanding of power and institutions.

name: Jacques Derrida
central_question: How can language and text destabilize meaning?
methodology: Deconstructive analysis, textual criticism, philosophical essays
core_concepts: Deconstruction, Différance, Trace, Logocentrism
key_works: Of Grammatology; Writing and Difference
neutral_academic_note: Founder of deconstruction; influential in philosophy, literary criticism, and cultural theory.

name: Umberto Eco
central_question: How do signs and symbols construct knowledge and culture?
methodology: Semiotic analysis, literary criticism, philosophical reflection
core_concepts: Semiotics, Interpretation, Textual Analysis, Sign Systems
key_works: The Name of the Rose; A Theory of Semiotics
neutral_academic_note: Bridged semiotics, literature, and philosophy; influential in cultural studies and media analysis.

name: Jürgen Habermas
school_of_thought: Frankfurt School, Critical Theory, Communicative Action
central_question: How can rational communication achieve consensus and democracy?
methodology: Social theory, philosophical essays, discourse analysis
core_concepts: Communicative Rationality, Public Sphere, Deliberative Democracy
key_works: The Theory of Communicative Action; The Structural Transformation of the Public Sphere
neutral_academic_note: Leading figure in critical theory; influential in sociology, political theory, and philosophy.

name: John Rawls
central_question: What principles of justice ensure fairness in society?
methodology: Analytical philosophy, thought experiments, social contract theory
core_concepts: Justice as Fairness, Original Position, Veil of Ignorance
key_works: A Theory of Justice; Political Liberalism
neutral_academic_note: Reshaped modern political philosophy; foundational to contemporary debates on justice and fairness.

name: Noam Chomsky
discipline: Linguistics, Philosophy, Cognitive Science, Political Activism
school_of_thought: Generative Grammar, Analytic Philosophy, Political Critique
central_question: How is language structured in the human mind and how does power operate in society?
methodology: Linguistic theory, philosophical analysis, political critique
core_concepts: Universal Grammar, Syntactic Structures, Propaganda Model
key_works: Syntactic Structures; Manufacturing Consent
neutral_academic_note: Founder of modern linguistics; influential in philosophy, cognitive science, and political thought.

name: Thomas Kuhn
central_question: How do scientific paradigms change and evolve over time?
methodology: Historical analysis, philosophy of science, case studies
core_concepts: Paradigm Shift, Normal Science, Scientific Revolutions
key_works: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
neutral_academic_note: Revolutionized philosophy of science; introduced the paradigm concept influencing multiple disciplines.

name: Karl Popper
central_question: How can scientific theories be rigorously tested and falsified?
methodology: Philosophical analysis, logical critique, methodological inquiry
core_concepts: Falsifiability, Critical Rationalism, Open Society
key_works: The Logic of Scientific Discovery; The Open Society and Its Enemies
neutral_academic_note: Foundational figure in philosophy of science; emphasized empirical testing and critical rationality.

name: Bertrand Russell
central_question: How can logic and mathematics clarify philosophical problems?
methodology: Logical analysis, mathematical reasoning, philosophical essays
core_concepts: Logic, Philosophy of Mathematics, Analytic Philosophy, Theory of Descriptions
key_works: Principia Mathematica; A History of Western Philosophy
neutral_academic_note: One of the founders of analytic philosophy; influential in logic, mathematics, and philosophy.

name: George Orwell
central_question: How do totalitarian regimes and propaganda manipulate societies?
methodology: Fiction, essays, journalism, political critique
core_concepts: Totalitarianism, Dystopia, Freedom, Propaganda
key_works: 1984; Animal Farm
neutral_academic_note: Influential writer and political thinker; critically examined authoritarianism and social control.

name: Aldous Huxley
central_question: How does technology and social engineering affect human freedom and society?
methodology: Fiction, essays, philosophical reflection
core_concepts: Dystopia, Social Engineering, Human Nature, Individual Freedom
key_works: Brave New World; The Doors of Perception
neutral_academic_note: Critically examined modernity, technology, and human psychology through literature and philosophy.

name: C.S. Lewis
central_question: How can faith and reason coexist and guide moral life?
methodology: Philosophical essays, fiction, apologetics
core_concepts: Morality, Faith and Reason, Christian Ethics, Imagination
key_works: Mere Christianity; The Chronicles of Narnia
neutral_academic_note: Bridged literature, philosophy, and theology; influential in Christian thought and moral philosophy.

name: J.R.R. Tolkien
central_question: How can myth and language shape culture and moral imagination?
methodology: Philological analysis, fiction writing, world-building
core_concepts: Myth, Language, Heroism, Good vs. Evil
key_works: The Lord of the Rings; The Hobbit
neutral_academic_note: Pioneering figure in modern fantasy literature; integrated philology and myth-making.

name: Wassily Kandinsky
central_question: How can visual forms express spiritual and emotional realities?
methodology: Artistic creation, theoretical writings on art
core_concepts: Abstract Art, Spirituality, Form and Color, Synesthesia
key_works: Concerning the Spiritual in Art; Point and Line to Plane
neutral_academic_note: Pioneer of abstract art; combined visual practice with philosophical reflection.

name: Frantz Fanon
central_question: How does colonialism affect identity, psychology, and liberation?
methodology: Political theory, psychoanalysis, historical analysis
core_concepts: Colonization, Racism, Liberation, Decolonization
key_works: The Wretched of the Earth; Black Skin, White Masks
neutral_academic_note: Key figure in postcolonial theory; influenced liberation movements, philosophy, and political thought.
